pros: Little work, good hours, fair benefits package.
cons: They cut back on everything here. Last month they took all the water coolers out of the hospital, and this place doesn't even have water fountains. If the work is slow here for just a minute they will start sending people home whether they like it or not. Overtime is absolutely out of the question.

review_title: The most backwards hospital I've ever encountered.
pros: Small town charm, small staff means administration knows your name.  Unfortunately, supplies are often unavailable, & they are very behind the times as far as technology...who still charts ON PAPER??
cons: My management is almost non existent, but when they grace us with their presence, it is to reprimand or criticize.  Rarely is interaction with management positive.  Frequently denied a lunch break.  Staffing is always tight.

pros: I could clock in late without penalty, cheap parking, clean restrooms. Maintenance and housekeeping are excellent  workers. Just didnt have much to work with.
cons: See below because there are too many to list. Even if you dont take all advice. Be sure to have an iron fist with those lazy managers and nurses.

pros: None!  Worst place ever.  Used to be A M I PARK PLAZA HOSPITAL - Arabian Medical Institute
cons: I went to work here and was overwhelmed with work while others sat behind closed doors and did NOTHING.  I did all the work assigned to me and more which included answering all the phones for buyers and managers.  I was constantly being harassed by a disgruntled female employee.  They did nothing to stop this ugly, Schizophrenic bully.  I was laid off after a month along with about 200 others.  Poor management and even worse Human Resources directors.

review_title: It is a good place to work if you want a "job" but not good if you want a "career".
pros: There is a sense of community: everyone knows eveyone.
cons:
-Lack of growth opportunies
-Favoritism, partiality, groupies
-Lack of recognition for hard work in some departments
-unexpected layoffs and staff reduction

pros: Good Location. Good physicians. Available Surgeries and ancillary testing are good. Staff serve well.
cons: Undergoing Tenet Health Restructuring. Staffing Lean. Redistribution of departments/personnel/processes is stressful.

pros: Some really good physicians practice at this facility.
cons: Very disorganized, disrespected by leadership, and coworkers.

pros: Teaches the opposite of how to run a hospital
cons: The hospital operates with the only intent of making a profit.

review_title: It was great until I was released due to reduction in force.

review_title: Worst place to ever work in over 10 years!
